thread.title: Police: 3 dead, 2 others critical in Brighton Park shooting | Chicago Sun-Times
thread.title_full: Police: 3 dead, 2 others critical in Brighton Park shooting | Chicago Sun-Times

title: Police: 3 dead, 2 others critical in Brighton Park shooting | Chicago Sun-Times
text:
Sign-Up for our News & Politics Newsletter Sign-Up 
Five people were shot — three fatally — Wednesday afternoon in the Brighton Park neighborhood on the Southwest Side. 
The shooting happened at 2:58 p.m. in the 3900 block of South Albany, according to Chicago Police. The group was inside a home when an unknown male walked inside and began shooting. 
A police source said the shooting appeared to be related to drugs. 
An 18-year-old man and a 19-year-old man, both shot in the head, were pronounced dead at the scene, police said. A third male victim, whose age was unknown, was taken with a gunshot wound to his torso to Mount Sinai Hospital, where he also died. 
The Cook County medical examiner’s office did not immediately confirm the deaths. 
Another 19-year-old man was shot on the side of his body and was taken to Mount Sinai, police said. A second 18-year-old man was shot in his torso and taken to Stroger Hospital. Both were in critical condition. Previously from Chicago News
